clinical_study.brief_title: The Feasibility and Advantages of Tubeless Uniportal Video-assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery in Total Thymectomy
clinical_study.official_title: The Feasibility and Advantages of Tubeless Uniportal Video-assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery in Total Thymectomy

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective cohort study.The main study content is the feasibility and advantages of tubeless uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery in total thymectomy,divided into exposed and non-exposed groups.Tubeless uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery in total thymectomy in the exposed group, uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery in total thymectomy in the non-exposed group.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective cohort study.The main study content is the feasibility and advantages of tubeless uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery in total thymectomy,divided into exposed and non-exposed groups.Communicating with the surgeon and patients who meet the inclusion criteria, decide whether to enter the exposed or non-exposed group.Exposed group with tubeless uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery in total thymectomy , non-exposed group with uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery in total thymectomy.By collecting personal information of two groups of patients and the corresponding observation indicators to analyze whether the treatment of thymoma with tubeless uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic thymectomy is more beneficial than the conventional uniportal video-assisted thoracoscope, and it is safe and feasible.

study_design_info.masking_description: This study is a prospective cohort study.Participants,Care Provider, and Investigator all know the grouping situation. The Investigator collect the information and observation indicators of the two groups of participants and send to the Outcomes Assessor . The Outcomes Assessor does not know the grouping situation of each participant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-1.Routine thoracic CT scan, CT showed anterior mediastinal tumor, no invasive peripheral vessels and organs, no pleural effusion and pericardial effusion.
2.Electrocardiogram, pulmonary function, color Doppler echocardiography, arteriovenous color Doppler ultrasound and other preoperative examination results are normal.
3.18 to 65-year old patient with thymoma who is eligible for Uniportal Video-assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery in Total Thymectomy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1.There is a potential infection before surgery 2.Heart and lung serious organic diseases 3.Myasthenia gravis 4.Combined thoracic adhesions, patients with severe coagulation insufficiency
